meanings.definition: characterized by or producing a strong, forceful gust of wind
meanings.sent1: The blasty storm knocked down trees and power lines.
meanings.sent2: The blasty wind made it difficult to walk outside.
meanings.sent3: The blasty breeze turned umbrellas inside out.
meanings.sent4: The blasty gusts howled through the night.
meanings.sent5: The blasty wind roared like a lion.

meanings.definition: causing damage or destruction by means of a sudden, powerful force
meanings.sent1: The blasty explosion shattered windows in the building.
meanings.sent2: The blasty impact left a trail of destruction behind.
meanings.sent3: The blasty crash startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The blasty force of the wave swept everything away.
meanings.sent5: The blasty strike left a mark that couldn't be erased.

meanings.definition: having a harsh or unpleasant sound or tone
meanings.sent1: The blasty music made my ears hurt.
meanings.sent2: The blasty voice on the intercom was hard to understand.
meanings.sent3: The blasty alarm woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The blasty noise of the construction site echoed through the street.
meanings.sent5: The blasty sound of the horn pierced the silence.
